remarks.format:
## Remarks ConnectionsZoneDesigner provides a design-time representation of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ConnectionsZone> control with a menu to access the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.WebParts.ConnectionsZoneDesigner.AutoFormats%2A> collection and the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.WebParts.ToolZoneDesigner.ViewInBrowseMode%2A> property for the convenience of the page developer. It is the only zone designer that does not support designer regions. This is because <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ConnectionsZone> controls uses links to create connections instead of a drag-and-drop user interface (UI).
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.WebParts.ConnectionsZoneDesigner.AutoFormats%2A> collection and the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.WebParts.ToolZoneDesigner.ViewInBrowseMode%2A> property both appear on the verbs menu of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ConnectionsZone> control. <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.WebParts.ConnectionsZoneDesigner.AutoFormats%2A>, when selected, provides a selection of color schemes. The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.WebParts.ToolZoneDesigner.ViewInBrowseMode%2A> check box, when selected, displays the contents of the control as it would appear in the browser; the control will be empty until a connection is made.
You can inherit from ConnectionsZoneDesigner to support a custom <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ConnectionsZone> control as with any other control designer. You can override the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.WebParts.ConnectionsZoneDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> method to change the markup that renders the control. You can also override the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.WebParts.ConnectionsZoneDesigner.AutoFormats%2A> collection to add a <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerAutoFormatCollection> with a custom scheme.
## Examples The following code example shows how to hide additional properties from a custom <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ConnectionsZone> control by overriding the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.WebParts.ConnectionsZoneDesigner.PreFilterProperties%2A> method.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The PreFilterProperties method overrides the parent method to hide the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebZone.EmptyZoneTextStyle%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebZone.PartChromeStyle%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebZone.PartStyle%2A>, and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebZone.PartTitleStyle%2A> properties in the designer. This is because the properties in question are not rendered by <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ConnectionsZone> controls and are therefore not relevant.
## Examples For an example of how to override the PreFilterProperties method, see the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.WebParts.ConnectionsZoneDesigner> class overview topic.
